California’s radical plan to defend homes from sea level rise: move them

California is beginning to adopt a bold and controversial proposal to protect its coasts from sea level rise and erosion: uprooting buildings and infrastructure near the ocean and relocating them farther inland. This concept, called “managed retreat,” represents a radical departure from decades of coastal development philosophy.
